metadata.title: CVE-2018-5729 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying tagged data that is internal to the database module. It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled tagged data. A remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information or cause a denial of service.

criterions.comment: krb5 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.16.1-1').
